text:
This SVG displays the superscript lower than it should.  Reducing the tspan font-size makes the 
effect more marked.  ASV renders it correctly.  My version is Batik 1.5 beta 4.

<?xml 
version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<!DOCTYPE svg PUBLIC "-//W3C//DTD SVG 
1.0//EN"
	"http://www.w3.org/TR/2001/REC-SVG-20010904/DTD/svg10.dtd">
<svg 
width="150" height="60">
  <text font-size="36" x="10" y="50">
    b<tspan baseline-
shift="super" font-size="0.5em">2</tspan> - 4ac
  </text>
</svg>

According to "10.9.2 
Baseline alignment properties" in the SVG 1.0 or 1.1 spec there should be one dominant baseline 
table which spans the content of the text element.  ISTM that the baseline-shift of the tspan is 
using the baseline table of the current, smaller font within the tspan rather than the dominant 
baseline table of the enclosing text.
